or folate deficiency and an alcohol- or drug-induced cytopenia. The differential diagnosis includes acute leukemia and myeloproliferative syndromes.
Most patients eventually progress to acute leukemic syndromes or die of complications of bone marrow failure.

MDS is suspected in patients with otherwise unexplained cytopenias, especially with dysplastic findings on peripheral blood smear. Macrocytic anemia is the most common cytopenia. Bone marrow findings show a hypercellular marrow with dysplastic erythroid precursors.
Detection of clonal abnormalities supports the diagnosis.
Look specifically for 5q− syndrome, a subtype of MDS that has a specific therapy.
